# Foreword
This Technical Report has been produced by the 3rd Generation Partnership
Project (3GPP).
The contents of the present document are subject to continuing work within the
TSG and may change following formal TSG approval. Should the TSG modify the
contents of the present document, it will be re-released by the TSG with an
identifying change of release date and an increase in version number as
follows:
Version x.y.z
where:
x the first digit:
1 presented to TSG for information;
2 presented to TSG for approval;
3 or greater indicates TSG approved document under change control.
y the second digit is incremented for all changes of substance, i.e. technical
enhancements, corrections, updates, etc.
z the third digit is incremented when editorial only changes have been
incorporated in the document.
In the present document, modal verbs have the following meanings:
**shall** indicates a mandatory requirement to do something
**shall not** indicates an interdiction (prohibition) to do something
The constructions \"shall\" and \"shall not\" are confined to the context of
normative provisions, and do not appear in Technical Reports.
The constructions \"must\" and \"must not\" are not used as substitutes for
\"shall\" and \"shall not\". Their use is avoided insofar as possible, and
they are not used in a normative context except in a direct citation from an
external, referenced, non-3GPP document, or so as to maintain continuity of
style when extending or modifying the provisions of such a referenced
document.
**should** indicates a recommendation to do something
**should not** indicates a recommendation not to do something
**may** indicates permission to do something
**need not** indicates permission not to do something
The construction \"may not\" is ambiguous and is not used in normative
elements. The unambiguous constructions \"might not\" or \"shall not\" are
used instead, depending upon the meaning intended.
**can** indicates that something is possible
**cannot** indicates that something is impossible
The constructions \"can\" and \"cannot\" are not substitutes for \"may\" and
\"need not\".
**will** indicates that something is certain or expected to happen as a result
of action taken by an agency the behaviour of which is outside the scope of
the present document
**will not** indicates that something is certain or expected not to happen as
a result of action taken by an agency the behaviour of which is outside the
scope of the present document
**might** indicates a likelihood that something will happen as a result of
action taken by some agency the behaviour of which is outside the scope of the
present document
**might not** indicates a likelihood that something will not happen as a
result of action taken by some agency the behaviour of which is outside the
scope of the present document
In addition:
**is** (or any other verb in the indicative mood) indicates a statement of
fact
**is not** (or any other negative verb in the indicative mood) indicates a
statement of fact
The constructions \"is\" and \"is not\" do not indicate requirements.
# 1 Scope
The present document is a technical report for E-UTRA-NR Dual connectivity
(DC) band combinations of LTE xDL/1UL (x=1,2,3,4) + inter-band NR 2DL/1UL
under Rel-16 time frame. The purpose is to gather the relevant background
information and studies in order to address EN-DC band combinations of LTE
xDL/1UL (x=1,2,3,4) + inter-band NR 2DL/1UL in Rel-16 as shown in Table 1-1.

text, constitute provisions of the present document.

number, version number, etc.) or non‑specific.

reference to a 3GPP document (including a GSM document), a non-specific
reference implicitly refers to the latest version of that document _in the
same Release as the present document_.

For the purposes of the present document, the terms and definitions given in
TR 21.905 [1] and the following apply.\ A term defined in the present document
takes precedence over the definition of the same term, if any, in TR 21.905
[1].

## 3.3 Abbreviations
For the purposes of the present document, the abbreviations given in TR 21.905
[1] and the following apply.\ An abbreviation defined in the present document

# 4 Background
The present document is a technical report for EN-DC band combinations of LTE
x bands (x=1,2,3,4) inter-band CA (x DL/1UL) + inter-band NR 2 bands (2DL/1UL)
under Rel-16 time frame. It covers both the UE and BS side. The document is
divided in two different parts:
\- General part: this part covers BS and UE specific which is band combination
independent.
\- Specific band combination part: this part covers each band combination and
its specific issues independently from each other (i.e. one subclause is
defined per band combination)
The specific band combination parts are independent and therefore, the working
speed also differs.
## 4.1 TR Maintenance
A single company is responsible for introducing all approved TPs in the
current TR, i.e. TR editor. However, it is the responsibility of the contact
person of each band combination to ensure that the TPs related to the band
combination have been implemented.
# 5 EN-DC band combinations of LTE x bands DL/1UL(x=1,2,3,4) + NR 2 bands
DL/1UL: General Part
## 5.1 UE RF architectures
RAN4 consider same example RF architecture which are described in section 5.1
in TR37.863-01-01. One different point is that LTE and NR modemchip can be
used one chip solutions from rel-16.
To support multiple component carriers in LTE and NR, RAN4 consider specific
RF components such as Diplexer, Triplexer, Quadplexer and Hexaplexer to derive
self-interference problems according to the LTE x bands DL/1UL(x=1,2,3,4) + NR
2 band DL/1UL EN-DC band combinations.
## 5.2 General treatment of ∆TIB and ∆RIB values
For the LTE x bands DL/1UL(x=1,2,3,4) + NR 2 band DL/1UL EN-DC band
combinations, RAN4 should consider to reuse agreed additional insertion losses
for all EN-DC band combinations in rel-15 when new RF components are not
introduced to support this basket WI. If the new RF components are introduced,
then more detail decription will be captured in some specific EN-DC band
combinations.

### 6.4.3 Co-existence studies
Based on co-existence studies of DC_5A_n78A and DC_5A_n257A specified in TR
37.863-01-01, there is no additional harmonic and intermodulation impact for
the additional band receiver.
\- DC_5A_n78A: No harmonic problems by 7^th^ & 8^th^ order between FR1 and FR2
\- DC_5A_n257A: Harmonic problem is already specified in TR 37.863-01-01

### 6.4.5 MSD
IMD issues are already analysed in TR 37.863-01-01 and there is no IMD issues
to 3^rd^ own Rx bands. Harmonics are expected in DC_5A_n78A-n257
configuration. DC_5A_n78A has 7^th^ and 8^th^ harmonics from n78 into n257 but
there is no harmonic problems by 7^th^ and 8^th^ order between FR1 and FR2.
Furthermore, DC_5A_n257A has 4^th^ harmonic from Band 5 into n78 but this
harmonic problem will be solved in DC_5A_n78A

### 6.6.3 Co-existence studies
Based on co-existence studies of DC_7A_n78A and DC_7A_n257A specified in TR
37.863-01-01, 7^th^ harmonic from Band 7 fall into Band n257 when dual uplink
is configured with Band 7+n78. There is no additional harmonic and
intermodulation impact for the additional band receiver.

### 6.9.3 Co-existence studies
Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n7 + Band n78 with UL Band 3 +Band n7
are already captured in Table 5.3-1 of TR 37.716-21-21 [2].
\- 2^nd^ order harmonic generated by uplink of Band 3 may also fall into own
Rx of band n78.
\- 4^th^ order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band n7 may also fall
into own Rx of band n7.
\- 3^rd^ order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band n7 may also fall
into own Rx of band n78.
Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n7 + Band n78 with UL Band 3 +Band n78
are already captured in Table 5.3-1 of TR 37.716-21-21 [2].
\- 2^nd^ order harmonic generated by uplink of Band 3 may also fall into own
Rx of band n78.
\- 2^nd^ , 4^th^ , 5^th^ order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band
n78 may also fall into own Rx of band 3.
\- 4^th^ , 5^th^ order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band n78 may
also fall into own Rx of band n78. But there is no issue for TDD band.

### 6.16.3 Co-existence studies
Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n28 + Band n78 with UL Band 3 +Band n78
are already captured in Table 5.3-1 of TR 37.716-21-21 [2].
\- 2^nd^ order harmonic generated by uplink of Band 3 may also fall into own
Rx of band n78.
\- 2^nd^ , 4^th^ , 5^th^ order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band
n78 may also fall into own Rx of band 3.
\- 4^th^ , 5^th^ order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band n78 may
also fall into own Rx of band n78. But there is no issue for TDD band.
Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n28 + Band n78 with UL Band 3 +Band n28
are already captured in Table 5.3-1 of TR 37.716-21-21 [2].
\- 2^nd^ order harmonic generated by uplink of Band 3 may also fall into own
Rx of band n78.
\- 5^th^ order harmonic generated by uplink of Band n28 may also fall into own
Rx of band n78.
\- 5^th^ order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band n28 may also fall
into own Rx of band n78.

### 6.39.3 Co-existence studies
Based on co-existence studies of Band 40 + Band n41, Band 40 + Band n79
captured in TR 37.716-11-11, the own Rx impact of the 3^rd^ band is the
followings, which is the same as that for CA_n40-n41-n79 captured in TR
38.716-03-02.
\- 2^nd^ order IMD (4796 MHz -- 5090 MHz) generated by 2UL of B40 + n41 fall
into part of own band n79.
\- 4th order IMD (4210 MHz -- 4704 MHz) generated by dual uplink of Band 40 +
Band n41 may fall into part of own band n79. However, since this band
combination will only be used in China where the frequency range above 4800
MHz for band n79 is allocated to IMT in China, there are no MSD issue.
\- As only inter-band carrier aggregation without simultaneous Rx/Tx between
n40 and n41 is supported, there are no MSD issue for n41 due to dual uplink
operation in _Band 40 + Band n79_

### 6.75.3 UE co-existence studies
The harmonic and IMD products caused by DC_3A_n3A-n77A and protected bands
follow from those derived for the constituent fallback modes, DC_3A_n3A,
DC_3A_n77A, and CA_n3A-n77A. The co-existence studies of DC_3A_n3A and
DC_3A_n77A are already captured in TR 37.863-01-01 [6], and the co-existence
studies of CA_n3A-n77A are captured in TR 37.865-01-01. In rel-15, only Single
Tx Switched UL mode is supported for DC_3A_n3A.
\- The 2nd harmonic interference from Band 3 or Band n3 UL will fall into Band
n77 DL frequency range
\- Note that in Rel.15, only single tx switched UL mode is supported for
DC_3A_n3A.
For dual uplink of Band 3 and Band n3 in rel-16, RAN4 need further study of
self desense problem as below
\- The 2nd IMD and 4^th^ IMD will be impact to Band n78 due to dual uplink
transmission by DC_3A_n3A.

IMD problems are already analysed in constituent low order combinations,
additional analysis is not needed.
\- Uplink DC configuration is DC_3A_n3A: Harmonic problem already discussed
and solved in DC_3A_n77A, CA_n3A-n7A. Note that only Single Tx Switched UL
mode is supported for DC_3A_n3A in Rel.15.
\- Uplink DC configuration is DC _3A_n77A: Harmonic problem already discussed
and solved in DC_3A_n77A, CA_n3A-n77A. IMD problem already discussed and
solved in DC_3A_n77A.
However, RAN4 need further studies on the self desense problem as for UE with
dual PA capability of DC_3A_n3A in Rel-16. Based on self desens analysis
results, these IMD2 and IMD4 MSD for DC_3_n3_n77/n78 under non-contiguous
DC_3_n3 is not needed based on MPR equation in TS 38.101-3.
\- To add a note in the TS38.101-3, Table 7.3B.2.3.5.2-1: MSD test points for
Scell due to dual uplink operation for EN-DC in NR FR1 (three bands):
Note X: For DC_3A_n3A-n77A, DC_3A_n3A-n78A paired with UL_DC_3A_n3A, the 3rd
DL bands n77/n78 are subject to IMD2 which MSD is not specified.

mode is supported for DC_3A_n3A in Rel.15.
\- Uplink DC configuration is DC _3A_n78A: Harmonic problem already discussed
and solved in DC_3A_n78A, CA_n3A-n78A. IMD problem already discussed and
solved in DC_3A_n78A.
However, RAN4 need further studies on the self desense problem as for UE with
dual PA capability of DC_3A_n3A in Rel-16. Based on self desense analysis
results, these IMD2 and IMD4 MSD for DC_3_n3_n77/n78 under non-contiguous
DC_3_n3 is not needed based on MPR equation in TS 38.101-3.
\- To add a note in the TS38.101-3, Table 7.3B.2.3.5.2-1: MSD test points for
Scell due to dual uplink operation for EN-DC in NR FR1 (three bands):
Note X: For DC_3A_n3A-n77A, DC_3A_n3A-n78A paired with UL_DC_3A_n3A, the 3rd
DL bands n77/n78 are subject to IMD2 which MSD is not specified.

\- 7th and 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 and 2nd, 3rd and 5th
order IMD may fall into own Rx of Band 3 when dual uplink is configured with
Band 1 + Band n78
\- 7th and 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 and 5th order IMD may
fall into own Rx of Band 1 when dual uplink is configured with Band 3 + Band
n78
\- 2nd harmonic from Band 1 may fall into n78 and 3rd order IMD may fall into
own Rx of Band 3 when dual uplink is configured with Band 1 + Band n257
\- 2nd harmonic from Band 3 may fall into n78 and 3rd order IMD may fall into
own Rx of Band 1 when dual uplink is configured with Band 3 + Band n257.

Co-existence studies of Band 1 + Band n78, Band 5 + Band n78, Band 1 + n257
and Band 5 + n257 are captured in TR 37.863-01-01, own Rx impact of the 3rd
band is the followings
> \- 7th and 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 and 5th order IMD may
> fall into own Rx of Band 5 when dual uplink is configured with Band 1+ Band
> n78
>
> \- 7th and 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 and 3rd order IMD may
> fall into own Rx of Band 1 when dual uplink is configured with Band 5 + Band
> n78
>
> \- 2nd harmonic from Band 1 may fall into n78 when dual uplink is configured
> with Band 1 + Band n257
>
> \- 4th harmonic from Band 5 may fall into n78 when dual uplink is configured
> with Band 5 + Band 257

### 7.5.3 Co-existence studies
Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n78, Band 5 + Band n78, Band 3 + n257
and Band 5 + n257 are captured in TR 37.863-01-01, own Rx impact of the 3rd
band is the followings
> \- 7th & 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 when dual uplink is
> configured with Band 3 + n78
>
> \- 7th & 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 and 3rd order IMD may
> fall into own Rx of Band 3 when dual uplink is configured with Band 5A + n78
>
> \- 2nd harmonic from Band 3 may fall into n78 when dual uplink is configured
> with Band 3 + n257
>
> \- 4th harmonic from Band 5 may fall into n78 when dual uplink is configured
> with Band 5 + n257

### 7.5.5 MSD
IMD problems are already analysed in constituent low order combinations
between LTE bands and NR bands. 2DL/2UL and 3DL/2UL captured in TR
37.863-01-01 and TR 37.863-02-01 respectively and fallback modes are captured
in TR 37.864-41-21. Therefore, additional analysis is not needed.
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_3A_n78A: Up to 7th harmonic order will be
> not any impact to n257
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_5A_n78A: There is no harmonic problems by
> 7th & 8th order between FR1 and FR2 and 3rd IMD problem is covered in
> DC_3A-5A_n78A
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_3A_n257A: Harmonic problem is already
> solved in DC_3A_n78A
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_5A_n257A: Harmonic problem is already
> solved in DC_5A_n78A

Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n78, Band 7 + Band n78, Band 3 + n257
and Band 7 + n257 are captured in TR 37.863-01-01
> \- 7th & 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 when dual uplink is
> configured with Band 3 + Band n78
>
> \- 7th harmonic from Band 7 may fall into n257 and 3rd & 4th IMDs may fall
> into Band 3 when dual uplink is configured with Band 7 + Band n78
>
> \- 2nd harmonic from Band 3 may fall into n78 when dual uplink is configured
> with Band 3 + Band n257

### 7.7.5 MSD
IMD problems are already analysed in constituent low order combinations
between LTE bands and NR bands. 2DL/2UL and 3DL/2UL captured in TR
37.863-01-01 and TR 37.863-02-01 respectively and fallback modes are captured
in TR 37.864-41-21. Therefore, additional analysis is not needed.
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_3A_n78A: Up to 7th harmonic order will be
> not any impact to n257
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_7A_n78A: Up to 7th harmonic order will be
> not impact to n257 and IMD problems are already covered in DC_3A-7A_n78A
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_3A_n257A: Harmonic problem is already
> solved in DC_3A_n78A

### 7.9.3 Co-existence studies
Co-existence studies of Band 5 + Band n78, Band 7 + Band n78, Band 5 + n257
and Band 7 + n257 are captured in TR 37.863-01-01
> \- 7th & 8th harmonics from n78 may fall into n257 and 2nd order IMD may
> fall into own Rx of Band 7 when dual uplink is configured with Band 5 + Band
> n78
>
> \- 7th harmonic from Band 7 may fall into Band n257 and 2nd order and 5th
> order IMD may fall into own Rx of Band 5 when dual uplink is configured with
> Band 7 + Band n78
>
> \- 4th harmonic from Band 5 may fall into n78 when dual uplink is configured
> with Band 5 + Band n257

### 7.9.5 MSD
IMD problems are already analysed in constituent low order combinations
between LTE bands and NR bands. 2DL/2UL and 3DL/2UL captured in TR
37.863-01-01 and TR 37.863-02-01 respectively and fallback modes are captured
in TR 37.864-41-21. Therefore, additional analysis is not needed.
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_5A_n78A: There is no harmonic problem by
> 7th & 8th order between FR1 and FR2 and 2nd IMD problem is already covered
> in DC_5A-7A_n78A
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_7A_n78A: Up to 7th harmonic order will be
> not any impact to n257 and IMD problems are already covered in DC_5A-7A_n78A
\- Uplink DC configuration is DC_5A_n257A: Harmonic problem is already solved
in DC_5A_n78A

### 7.44.3 Co-existence studies
Co-existence studies of Band 1 + Band n77, Band 3 + Band n77, Band 1 + n257
and Band 3 + n257 are captured in TR 37.863-01-01, own Rx impact of the 3rd
band is the followings
\- 7th and 8th harmonics from n77 may fall into n257 and 2nd, 3rd and 5th
order IMD may fall into own Rx of Band 3 when dual uplink is configured with
Band 1 + Band n77
\- 7th and 8th harmonics from n77 may fall into n257 and 5th order IMD may
fall into own Rx of Band 1 when dual uplink is configured with Band 3 + Band
n77
\- 2nd harmonic from Band 1 may fall into n77 and 3rd order IMD may fall into
own Rx of Band 3 when dual uplink is configured with Band 1 + Band n257
\- 2nd harmonic from Band 3 may fall into n77 and 3rd order IMD may fall into
own Rx of Band 1 when dual uplink is configured with Band 3 + Band n257.

### 7.44.5 MSD
IMD problems are already analysed in constituent low order combinations
between LTE bands and NR bands. 2DL/2UL and 3DL/2UL captured in TR
37.863-01-01 and TR 37.863-02-01 respectively and fallback modes are captured
in TR 37.864-41-21. Therefore, additional analysis is not needed.
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_1A_n77A: Up to 7th harmonic order will be
> not any impact to n257 and IMD issues on 3rd own Rx band will be covered in
> DC_1A-3A_n77A
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC _3A_n77A: Up to 7th harmonic order will be
> not any impact to n257 and IMD problems will be covered in DC_1A-3A_n77A
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_1A_n257A: Harmonic problem already
> discussed and solved in DC_1A_n77A
>
> \- Uplink DC configuration is DC_3A_n257A: Harmonic problem is already
> solved in DC_3A_n77A

### 7.45.3 Co-existence studies
Co-existence analysis for DC_2_n41 shows that there are IMD2 and IMD5 impacts
from DC_2_n41 UL to Band n71 DL, but no impact on 66 DL
Co-existence analysis for DC_2_n71 shows that there is IMD2 impact from
DC_2_n71 UL to Band n41 DL, but no impact on 66 DL
Co-existence analysis for DC_66_n41 shows that there is IMD4 impact from
DC_66_n41 UL to Band 2 DL, but no impact on n71 DL
Co-existence analysis for DC_66_n71 shows that there is no impact from
DC_66_n71 UL to either Band 2 DL or Band n41 DL

### 7.45.5 MSD
UL 2_n41 into DL n71 create IMD2 and UL 2_n71 into DL n41 create IMD2, and
they are both captured in the lower order combination DC_2_n41-n71.
UL 66_n41 into DL n2 create IMD4, and this is captured in the lower order
combination DC_2-66_n41.
Based on the co-existence studies there are no further MSD needed to be
defined.

those of the 2DL/2UL and 3DL/2UL captured in TR 37.863-01-01 and TR
37.863-02-01 respectively. Furthermore, harmonics and IMD issues are covered
by constituent fallback modes in TR 37.864-41-21. Therefore, additional
analysis is not needed.

### 8.23.3 Co-existence studies
Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n78, Band 7 + Band n78 and Band 8 \+
Band n78 are captured in TR 37.863-01-01.
Co-existence studies of Band 3 + Band n1, Band 7 + Band n1 and Band 8 + Band
n1 are captured in TR 37.716-11-11.
Own Rx impact on the 3rd band:
\- 2nd and 4th order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band n1 may fall
into own Rx of band n78.
\- 5th order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 3 + Band n78 may fall into
own Rx of band n1.
\- 4th and 5th order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 7 + Band n1 may fall
into own Rx of band n78.
\- 5th order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 7 + Band n1 may fall into
own Rx of band 8.
\- 2nd and 5th order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 7 + Band n78 may
fall into own Rx of band 8.
\- 3rd and 4th order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 7 + Band n78 may
fall into own Rx of band 3.
\- 4th order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 7 + Band n78 may also fall
into own Rx of band n1
> \- 3rd order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 8 + Band n1 may fall into
> own Rx of band n78.
>
> \- 3rd order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 8 + Band n78 may fall into
> own Rx of band 3.
>
> \- 2nd order IMD generated by dual uplink of Band 8 + Band n78 may fall into
> own Rx of band 7.

harmonic and intermodulation impact for the additional band receiver.

harmonic and intermodulation impact for the additional band receiver.

those of the 2DL/2UL and 3DL/2UL captured in TR 37.863-01-01 and TR

analysis is not needed.

receiver.
